If letters are in lowercase, they are written as a, b, c, etc. not A, B, C, etc.: Everything must be in lowercase — no capitals! I had to change the tags used in the news and sidebar pages from uppercase to lowercase. In this context, consider upper- and lower-case to be the same. Compare
uppercase noun mainly US
More examplesFewer examplesThe ear hears the name and doesn’t distinguish between uppercase and lowercase.While capital letters appear as one big block, mixing upper and lowercase gives words distinctive patterns.Suddenly I'm realizing that my name is in lowercase.
